title: Scenarios
text: Key scenarios include: SSPs, .e. SSP1-5 SDPs, .e. SDP, SDP_EI, SDP_MC SDP_RC scenarios span 1960 2150, yearly data 2030, data every 5 years thereafter.

previous_headings: Key scenarios > GDP per capita and GDP
title: Scenarios
text: Suggested overall reference scenario construction: Koch Leimbach 2023 (link). SSP GDP per capita scenarios constructed using: WDI data (link) 1990 2022 (missing country data filled MI data (link) James data (link, specifically WB_ID series)) extended backwards 1960 using growth rates MI James, growth rates IMF GDP per capita projections (link) 2029, SSP GDP per capita projections (SSP OECD projections link, release 3.0.1 (March 2024)) 2100. scenarios extended 2150 using bezier curve method assumes slope 2100 flattened half 2150. countries lacking projection data, last historical data point used future years. details harmonization, see Koch Leimbach 2023 (link). SSP GDP scenarios product GDP per capita population scenarios.

previous_headings: Key scenarios > GDP per capita and GDP
title: Scenarios
text: Suggested overall reference SDP scenarios: Bjoern Soergel et al 2024 Environ. Res. Lett. 19 124009 (link). SDP GDP per capita scenarios based SSP1, different harmonization functions different SDPs. SDP GDP scenarios product GDP per capita population scenarios.

title: Scenarios
text: SSP population scenarios constructed using: WDI data (link) 1960 2022 (missing country data filled UN_PopDiv data (link, 2022 revision) MI data (link)), growth rates World Bank’s Population Projections database (link) 2029, growth rates SSP population projections (release 3.0.1 (March 2024) link link), filled UN_PopDiv data (link, 2022 revision)) 2100. scenarios extended 2150 using bezier curve method assumes slope 2100 flattened half 2150. countries lacking projection data, last historical data point used future years. details harmonization, see Koch Leimbach 2023 (link).

title: Scenarios
text: SDP scenarios equal SSP1 scenario.

title: Scenarios
text: SSPs labour scenarios constructed using past WDI data (link) 1960 2022 (missing country data filled UN_PopDiv data (link, 2022 revision)), SSP labour projections (link) 2100. labor projections glued data, harmonization.

title: Scenarios
text: SDP scenarios equal SSP1 scenario.

title: Scenarios
text: SSPs urban population share scenarios constructed using past WDI data starting 1960 (link), SSP urban population share projections (2018 Release link). harmonization uses past levels, future growth rates.

title: Scenarios
text: SDP, SDP_EI, SDP_MC scenarios equal SSP1 scenario. SDP_RC equal SSP3 OECD countries, SSP2 non-OECD countries.

title: Scenarios
text: tool function toolGetScenarioDefinition() can used see driver/scenario options available.
code: toolGetScenarioDefinition() %>% print(n = 200) #> # A tibble: 50 × 5 #>    driver     scenario        pastData         futureData          harmonization #>    <chr>      <chr>           <chr>            <chr>               <chr>         #>  1 GDPpc      SSPs            WDI-MI-James     SSPs                GDPpcSSPs     #>  2 GDPpc      SSP1            WDI-MI-James     SSP1                GDPpcSSPs     #>  3 GDPpc      SSP2            WDI-MI-James     SSP2                GDPpcSSPs     #>  4 GDPpc      SSP3            WDI-MI-James     SSP3                GDPpcSSPs     #>  5 GDPpc      SSP4            WDI-MI-James     SSP4                GDPpcSSPs     #>  6 GDPpc      SSP5            WDI-MI-James     SSP5                GDPpcSSPs     #>  7 GDPpc      SDPs            -                -                   GDPpcSDPs     #>  8 GDPpc      ISIMIP          WDI-MI-James     SSPs                GDPpcSSPs     #>  9 GDPpc      SSP2IndiaDEAs   WDI-MI-James     IndiaDEAs-SSP2      GDPpcSSP2Ind… #> 10 GDPpc      SSP2IndiaMedium WDI-MI-James     IndiaDEAbase-SSP2   GDPpcSSP2Ind… #> 11 GDPpc      SSP2IndiaHigh   WDI-MI-James     IndiaDEAopt-SSP2    GDPpcSSP2Ind… #> 12 GDP        SSPs            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 13 GDP        SSP1            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 14 GDP        SSP2            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 15 GDP        SSP3            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 16 GDP        SSP4            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 17 GDP        SSP5            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 18 GDP        SDPs            -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 19 GDP        ISIMIP          -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 20 GDP        SSP2IndiaDEAs   -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 21 GDP        SSP2IndiaMedium -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 22 GDP        SSP2IndiaHigh   -                -                   GDPpcWithPop  #> 23 Population SSPs            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSPs-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 24 Population SSP1            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP1-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 25 Population SSP2            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP2-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 26 Population SSP3            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP3-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 27 Population SSP4            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP4-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 28 Population SSP5            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP5-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 29 Population SDPs            WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SDPs-UN_PopDiv      PopSSPs       #> 30 Population ISIMIP          UN_PopDiv-MI     SSPs-UN_PopDiv      PopISIMIP     #> 31 Population SSP2IndiaDEAs   WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI IndiaDEAs-SSP2-UN_… PopSSP2India… #> 32 Population SSP2IndiaMedium WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI IndiaDEAbase-SSP2-… PopSSP2India… #> 33 Population SSP2IndiaHigh   WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI IndiaDEAopt-SSP2-U… PopSSP2India… #> 34 Labour     SSPs            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSPs-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 35 Labour     SSP1            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP1-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 36 Labour     SSP2            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP2-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 37 Labour     SSP3            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP3-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 38 Labour     SSP4            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP4-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 39 Labour     SSP5            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP5-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 40 Labour     SDPs            WDI-UN_PopDiv    SDPs-UN_PopDiv      pastAndLevel  #> 41 Labour     SSP2IndiaDEAs   -                -                   LabourSSP2In… #> 42 Labour     SSP2IndiaMedium -                -                   LabourSSP2In… #> 43 Labour     SSP2IndiaHigh   -                -                   LabourSSP2In… #> 44 Urban      SSPs            WDI              SSPs                pastAndGrowth #> 45 Urban      SSP1            WDI              SSP1                pastAndGrowth #> 46 Urban      SSP2            WDI              SSP2                pastAndGrowth #> 47 Urban      SSP3            WDI              SSP3                pastAndGrowth #> 48 Urban      SSP4            WDI              SSP4                pastAndGrowth #> 49 Urban      SSP5            WDI              SSP5                pastAndGrowth #> 50 Urban      SDPs            WDI              SDPs                pastAndGrowth

title: Scenarios
text: user can create custom scenarios creating tibble called “mrdivers_scenarios” global environment, filling desired scenario definitions. structure “mrdivers_scenarios” object identical return object toolGetScenarioDefinition(), scenario building blocks available. example, say user wanted create SSP scenarios, without using Missing Islands data-set. following command executed global environment make “nomi” (-missing islands) scenario available.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Johannes Koch. Author, maintainer. Bjoern Soergel. Author. Deborra Leip. Author. Falk Benke. Author. Jan Philipp Dietrich. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Koch J, Soergel B, Leip D, Benke F, Dietrich J (2025). mrdrivers: Create GDP Population Scenarios. R package version 7.1.0, https://github.com/pik-piam/mrdrivers, https://pik-piam.github.io/mrdrivers.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mrdrivers: Create GDP and Population Scenarios},   author = {Johannes Koch and Bjoern Soergel and Deborra Leip and Falk Benke and Jan Philipp Dietrich},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 7.1.0, https://github.com/pik-piam/mrdrivers},   url = {https://pik-piam.github.io/mrdrivers}, }

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: R package mrdrivers, version 7.1.0

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: Create GDP population scenarios package constructs GDP population scenarios used drivers REMIND MAgPIE models.

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: package depends upon madrat magclass packages. integrates madrat framework structured accordingly. mainly uses magpie objects (magclass package). information madrat magclass, please visit respective github repositories (madrat, magclass).

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: key madrat::readSource() madrat::calcOutput() functions provided package listed . readSource: calcOutput: number important /useful tool functions: function tooGetUnitDollar() default unit monetary units REMIND MAgPIE defined. function tooGetScenarioDefinition() scenarios defined can helpful searching scenario information. functions toolGeneralConvert(), toolHarmonizePast() toolHarmonizeFuture() handle common tasks potentially useful outside mrdrivers.

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: See vignette("scenarios") information - references - available scenarios.

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: installation recent package version additional repository added R: additional repository can made available permanently adding line file called .Rprofile stored home folder system (Sys.glob("~") R returns home directory). recent version package can installed using install.packages: Package updates can installed using update.packages (make sure additional repository added running command):

title: Create GDP and Population Scenarios
text: package comes vignette describing basic functionality package use . can load following command (package needs installed):

title: Vectorised scenario construction — calcDriver
text: Internal function called main mrdrivers calc functions, maps vectorised arguments. interest package developers.

title: Vectorised scenario construction — calcDriver
code: calcDriver(   driver,   scenario,   popAsWeight = FALSE,   naming = "scenario",   extension2150 = "bezier" )

title: Vectorised scenario construction — calcDriver
text: driver string designating driver. Available drivers : GDP Population GDPpc Labour Urban scenario string (vector strings) designating scenario(s) returned. Use toolGetScenarioDefinition() learn scenarios available. popAsWeight TRUE, population data scenario used weight. naming DEPRECATED - removed next release. extension2150 string specifying /scenarios extended 2150. Can either: "bezier" (default): bezier curve extension leads smooth flattening scenario: slope last year scenario halved 2150. Currently works scenarios 2100 last year. "constant": last value scenarios taken constant 2150. "none": extension.

title: Vectorised scenario construction — calcDriver
text: magpie object requested output data either country regional level depending choice argument "aggregate" list information supplementary set TRUE.

title: Vectorised scenario construction — calcDriver
text: Vectors accepted arguments. given vector, different combinations created returned . one argument vectorised, arguments length. time series created can illustrated following example. say "harmonization" "pastdata" arguments vectors length 3. total 3 time series produced: first time series result combining first harmonization element first pastdata element, second time series result combining second harmonization element second pastdata element, third time series result using respective third entry. futuredata element used case , since example one futuredata element provided.

what: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
title: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
text: Like scenarios mrdrivers, GDP GDP per capita scenarios result harmonization exercise past data future projections. Together corresponding population scenarios (see calcPopulation()) comprise consistent set scenarios. scenario argument used designate scenario(s) returned. Currently available GDP scenarios : SSPs, SSP1, SSP2, SSP3, SSP4, SSP5, SDPs, ISIMIP, SSP2IndiaDEAs, SSP2IndiaMedium, SSP2IndiaHigh. See vignette: vignette("scenarios") /toolGetScenarioDefinition() information, scenario options, definitions references.

title: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
code: calcGDP(   scenario,   unit = toolGetUnitDollar(inPPP = TRUE),   average2020 = TRUE,   ... )  calcGDPpc(   scenario,   unit = toolGetUnitDollar(inPPP = TRUE),   average2020 = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
text: scenario string (vector strings) designating scenario(s) returned. Use toolGetScenarioDefinition() learn scenarios available. unit string specifying unit GDP. Can either: "constant 2017 Int$PPP" (default): Scenarios constructed constant 2017 Int$PPP. "constant 2017 US$MER": Scenarios constructed constant 2017 Int$PPP converted GDPuc::toolConvertGDP(). cases, GDP returned millions. average2020 TRUE (default), 2020 value replaced 2018-2022 average. consistent, yearly resolution decreased 5 year intervals. ... Arguments passed calcDriver extension2150 string specifying /scenarios extended 2150. Can either: "bezier" (default): bezier curve extension leads smooth flattening scenario: slope last year scenario halved 2150. Currently works scenarios 2100 last year. "constant": last value scenarios taken constant 2150. "none": extension.

title: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
text: magpie object requested output data either country regional level depending choice argument "aggregate" list information supplementary set TRUE.

title: Get GDP and GDP per capita scenarios — calcGDP
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Return all SSP scenarios calcOutput("GDP", scenario = "SSPs")  # Return only the SSP2 GDP scenario calcOutput("GDP", scenario = "SSP2")  # Return the SSP and SDP GDPpc scenarios calcOutput("GDP", scenario = c("SSPs", "SDPs")) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ calcOutput("GDPpc") } # }

title: Get scenario building blocks — calcGDPPast
text: Get past future scenario building blocks. scenario data required, even just single year, always use calc call final scenario, e.g. calcGDP() calcPopulation(), returned calc...Past calc...Future functions may end scenario, depending harmonization function. functions still exported compatibility existing code PIAM input data pipeline. See vignette: vignette("scenarios") references different data sources. See "Combining data sources '-'" section combine data sources.

title: Get scenario building blocks — calcGDPPast
code: calcGDPPast(   pastData = toolGetScenarioDefinition("GDPpc", "SSPs")$pastData,   extension1960 = "MI-James" )  calcGDPpcPast(scenario = "SSPs")  calcGDPFuture(futureData)  calcGDPpcFuture(scenario)  calcPopulationFuture(futureData)  calcLabourFuture(futureData)  calcUrbanFuture(futureData)  calcPopulationPast(   pastData = toolGetScenarioDefinition("Population", "SSPs")$pastData )  calcLabourPast(pastData = toolGetScenarioDefinition("Labour", "SSPs")$pastData)  calcUrbanPast(pastData = toolGetScenarioDefinition("Urban", "SSPs")$pastData)

title: Get scenario building blocks — calcGDPPast
text: pastData string specifying sources historic data. extension1960 string specifying data extended backwards 1960. scenario string specifying scenario, historic GDP population data sources taken. futureData string specifying sources future projections.

title: Get scenario building blocks — calcGDPPast
text: Data sources can combined "-" passed pastData futureData arguments, .e. "WDI-MI". signifies WDI data taken first, missing data filled data MI.

title: Get harmonized data — calcHarmonizedData
text: magpie object requested output data either country regional level depending choice argument "aggregate" list information supplementary set TRUE.

what: Get population and labour scenarios — calcPopulation
title: Get population and labour scenarios — calcPopulation
text: Like scenarios mrdrivers, Population, Labour Urban population share scenarios result harmonization exercise past data future projections. scenario argument used designate scenario(s) returned. Currently available Population scenarios : SSPs, SSP1, SSP2, SSP3, SSP4, SSP5, SDPs, ISIMIP, SSP2IndiaDEAs, SSP2IndiaMedium, SSP2IndiaHigh. See vignette: vignette("scenarios") /toolGetScenarioDefinition() information, scenario options, definitions references.

title: Get population and labour scenarios — calcPopulation
Get population and labour scenarios — calcPopulation
text: scenario string (vector strings) designating scenario(s) returned. Use toolGetScenarioDefinition() learn scenarios available. ... Arguments passed calcDriver extension2150 string specifying /scenarios extended 2150. Can either: "bezier" (default): bezier curve extension leads smooth flattening scenario: slope last year scenario halved 2150. Currently works scenarios 2100 last year. "constant": last value scenarios taken constant 2150. "none": extension. asShare TRUE (default) urban population shares returned. FALSE, urban population millions returned.

title: Get population and labour scenarios — calcPopulation
text: magpie object requested output data either country regional level depending choice argument "aggregate" list information supplementary set TRUE.

title: Read-in data from the Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSP) — readSSP
text: x MAgPIE object returned readSSP subtype string, either "", "gdp", "pop", "lab", "urb" subset vector strings designating scenarios. Defaults c("SSP1", "SSP2", "SSP3", "SSP4", "SSP5"). "Historical Reference" also available scenario.

title: Read-in data from the Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSP) — readSSP
text: read-data, usually magpie object. supplementary TRUE list including data metadata returned instead. temporal data dimensionality match source data. spatial dimension either match source data , convert argument set TRUE, ISO code country level.

what: Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
title: Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
text: Download, read-convert WDI (World development indicators) data.

title: Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
text: subtype string. Type WDI data read. Use World Bank indicator abbreviation. Available subtypes : "pop" "SP.POP.TOTL": Population, total "lab" "SP.POP.1564.": Working age population (15-64 years old) "urb" "SP.URB.TOTL..ZS": Urban Population (% total) "gdp" "NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.KD": GDP, PPP (constant 2017 international Dollar) "NV.AGR.TOTL.KD": Ag GDP, MER, (2010 US$) "PA.NUS.PPPC.RF": Price level ratio PPP conversion factor (GDP) market exchange rate "AG.SRF.TOTL.K2": Surface area (square kms) x MAgPIE object returned readWDI

title: Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
text: read-data, usually magpie object. supplementary TRUE list including data metadata returned instead. temporal data dimensionality match source data. spatial dimension either match source data , convert argument set TRUE, ISO code country level.

title: Read-in data from the World Bank's World Development Indicator (WDI) database. — downloadWDI
text: workflow update WDI data following: call download function manually, rename new WDI.rds file including download date. change file_name read readWDI. ensures, past data changed users.

Extend until 2150 in 5 year time steps — toolExtend2150
text: data list "x", magpie object, "description" elements extension2150 string specifying /scenarios extended 2150. Can either: "bezier" (default): bezier curve extension leads smooth flattening scenario: slope last year scenario halved 2150. Currently works scenarios 2100 last year. "constant": last value scenarios taken constant 2150. "none": extension.

code: toolGetScenarioDefinition(   driver = NULL,   scen = NULL,   aslist = FALSE,   getGroupShortcuts = FALSE )

title: Get information on available scenarios — toolGetScenarioDefinition
text: driver NULL character vector designating driver information returned. NULL, information drivers returned. Available drivers : GDP Population GDPpc Labour Urban scen NULL character vector designating scenario information returned. NULL, information scenarios returned. aslist TRUE FALSE (default). TRUE pastData, futureData harmonization strings returned list. getGroupShortcuts TRUE FALSE (default). TRUE return list scenario group shortcuts.

title: Get information on available scenarios — toolGetScenarioDefinition
text: tibble driver scenario information.

title: Get information on available scenarios — toolGetScenarioDefinition
code: toolGetScenarioDefinition() #> # A tibble: 50 × 5 #>    driver scenario        pastData     futureData        harmonization      #>    <chr>  <chr>           <chr>        <chr>             <chr>              #>  1 GDPpc  SSPs            WDI-MI-James SSPs              GDPpcSSPs          #>  2 GDPpc  SSP1            WDI-MI-James SSP1              GDPpcSSPs          #>  3 GDPpc  SSP2            WDI-MI-James SSP2              GDPpcSSPs          #>  4 GDPpc  SSP3            WDI-MI-James SSP3              GDPpcSSPs          #>  5 GDPpc  SSP4            WDI-MI-James SSP4              GDPpcSSPs          #>  6 GDPpc  SSP5            WDI-MI-James SSP5              GDPpcSSPs          #>  7 GDPpc  SDPs            -            -                 GDPpcSDPs          #>  8 GDPpc  ISIMIP          WDI-MI-James SSPs              GDPpcSSPs          #>  9 GDPpc  SSP2IndiaDEAs   WDI-MI-James IndiaDEAs-SSP2    GDPpcSSP2IndiaDEAs #> 10 GDPpc  SSP2IndiaMedium WDI-MI-James IndiaDEAbase-SSP2 GDPpcSSP2IndiaDEAs #> # ℹ 40 more rows toolGetScenarioDefinition(driver = "GDP") #> # A tibble: 11 × 5 #>    driver scenario        pastData futureData harmonization #>    <chr>  <chr>           <chr>    <chr>      <chr>         #>  1 GDP    SSPs            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  2 GDP    SSP1            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  3 GDP    SSP2            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  4 GDP    SSP3            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  5 GDP    SSP4            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  6 GDP    SSP5            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  7 GDP    SDPs            -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  8 GDP    ISIMIP          -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #>  9 GDP    SSP2IndiaDEAs   -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #> 10 GDP    SSP2IndiaMedium -        -          GDPpcWithPop  #> 11 GDP    SSP2IndiaHigh   -        -          GDPpcWithPop  toolGetScenarioDefinition(scen = "SSP2") #> # A tibble: 5 × 5 #>   driver     scenario pastData         futureData     harmonization #>   <chr>      <chr>    <chr>            <chr>          <chr>         #> 1 GDPpc      SSP2     WDI-MI-James     SSP2           GDPpcSSPs     #> 2 GDP        SSP2     -                -              GDPpcWithPop  #> 3 Population SSP2     WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI SSP2-UN_PopDiv PopSSPs       #> 4 Labour     SSP2     WDI-UN_PopDiv    SSP2-UN_PopDiv pastAndLevel  #> 5 Urban      SSP2     WDI              SSP2           pastAndGrowth toolGetScenarioDefinition(driver = "Population", scen = "SSPs", aslist = TRUE) #> $driver #> [1] "Population" #>  #> $scenario #> [1] "SSPs" #>  #> $pastData #> [1] "WDI-UN_PopDiv-MI" #>  #> $futureData #> [1] "SSPs-UN_PopDiv" #>  #> $harmonization #> [1] "PopSSPs" #>

text: string monetary unit, currently constant 2017 US$MER.

code: toolGetUnitDollar() #> [1] "constant 2017 US$MER" toolGetUnitDollar(inPPP = TRUE) #> [1] "constant 2017 Int$PPP" toolGetUnitDollar(returnOnlyBase = TRUE) #> [1] "2017"

what: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
text: Like harmonization tools mrdrivers, toolHarmonizeFuture takes two magpie objects, 'past' 'future', returns single magpie object, .e. harmonized time-series. case, harmonized time-series always equal 'future', years 'future'. harmonized time-series depends 'method' argument chosen.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
text: past magpie object. future magpie object one scenario/datatype, .e. length third dimension 1. method string defining harmonization method: "level": harmonized time-series exactly equal 'past' years first year 'future'. "growth": harmonized time-series follows growth rates 'past', years first year 'future'.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
text: magpie object dimensions 'past'.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture
text: 'past' object multiple scenarios/datatypes, .e. length third dimension larger 1, harmonized time-series created every scenario/datatype past. 'future' object used every case - hence requirement 'future' one scenario/datatype.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the future data — toolHarmonizeFuture

what: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
text: Like harmonization tools mrdrivers, toolHarmonizePast takes two magpie objects, 'past' 'future', returns single magpie object, .e. harmonized time-series. case, harmonized time-series always equal 'past', years 'past'. harmonized time-series depends 'method' argument chosen.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
text: past magpie object one scenario/datatype, .e. length third dimension 1. future magpie object. method string defining harmonization method: "level": harmonized time-series exactly equal 'future' years last year 'past'. "growth": harmonized time-series follows growth rates 'future', years last year 'past'. "transition": harmonized time-series transitions 'future' year 'yEnd'. yEnd, harmonized time-series equal 'future'. transition phase, share absolute difference past' future' last year past' added future. share starts 1 last year 'past' decreases linearly 0 yEnd. yEnd Additional input "transition" method. Year transition period completed.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
text: magpie object dimensions 'future'.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
text: 'future' object multiple scenarios/datatypes, .e. length third dimension larger 1, harmonized time-series created every scenario/datatype future. 'past' object used every case - hence requirement 'past' one scenario/datatype.

title: Tool to harmonize future data to past data, without modifying the past data — toolHarmonizePast
